page.title: 15ST PETER'S CHURCH,BROUGHTON
page.content: THIS CHURCH WAS BUILT IN THE LATE GOTHIC STYLE IN 1630 AS A PRIVATE FAMILY CHAPEL OF THE BROUGHTONS.IN 1711 LOCAL FAMILIES WERE ALLOWED TO WORSHIP THERE.BUILT FROM LOCAL RED SANDSTONE QUARRIED 400 YARDS AWAY,THE CHURCH CONTAINS THE ORIGINAL 17TH CENTURY BOX PEWS.THE TIMBER USED IS MAINLY LOCAL OAK.THERE ARE MEMORIALS ON THE WALLS TO MEMBERS OF THE DELVES-BROUGHTON AND YONGE FAMILIES WHO PROVIDED INCUMBENTS OVER THE YEARS.SOME OF THE SPLENDID STAINED GLASS WINDOWS PRE-DATE THE CHURCH.THE ECCLESIASTICAL PARISH OF BROUGHTON WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1907,UNTIL THEN ST.PETER'S HAD BEEN A CHAPEL WITHIN THE PARISH OF CROXTON,ITSELF CARVED OUT OF THE ANCIENT PARISH OF ECCLESHALL.THE PARISH OF BROUGHTON NUMBERS ABOUT 200 AND IS UNITED WITH CROXTON AND ADBASTON.
